selectedWork.heading: Selected Projects
selectedWork.intro: A few projects that show how I build: clarity through structure, feedback loops that actually close, and systems that can evolve without drifting.

pillars.title: Start with intent, not output
pillars.body: I frame the job to be done, success conditions, and constraints early—so implementation stays aligned with what people actually need.

pillars.title: Design feedback as a system property
pillars.body: I prefer structural inclusion over “bring people in.” The work should naturally surface signal: usage, outcomes, and why decisions were made.

pillars.title: Make reasoning and behavior explainable
pillars.body: If a system can’t explain itself, it can’t be trusted. I build traceability into decisions, changes, and outcomes.

pillars.title: Build for revision, not perfection
pillars.body: I treat systems as living. The goal is stable improvement: iterate with integrity, reduce drift, and keep change safe.

auroraPreview.heading: Aurora: Conversational Software
auroraPreview.body: Aurora is a conceptual approach to building software through conversation—intent, shared understanding, and results tied together with clear feedback. It influences how I design products to be explainable, revisable, and structurally aligned with how people actually think.

aboutPreview.heading: My Background
aboutPreview.body: Before I wrote software, I led large-scale operations and redesigned the workflows beneath the work. That same instinct now shows up in tools and platforms: build the structure, close the loop, and keep the system honest as conditions change.
